text: [Music]
what's great about this session is that
it's not vit engineers this is the
finance people who are supporting the IT
engineers and they're trying to figure
out how to leverage the cloud and
achieve these savings because I see
every other company is starting to do it
too my company is really in like a
transformational phase right now where
we're doing a lot of in-house migration
to other computing solutions and this is
very relevant for the way our businesses
is transforming right now one of the
things that I personally learned today
was a lot of companies are also going
through the same cartax that we are and
trying to migrate from our private cloud
infrastructure over to our public
private instruction we wanted to enable
our customers to network with each other
we wanted to enable customer
peer-to-peer learning and we hoped to
use this event to gain a little insight
into the finance community and their
needs from AWS it was interesting to
hear from people from other verticals
that that have been successful dow jones
and wall street journal' comm that that
story is very compelling so I came here
today to kind of network and hear about
best practices for optimizing cloud
costs see the different questions that
CFOs are bringing to their finance and
their tech teams and kind of seeing the
collaboration across the board I love
events like this because it gives me a
chance to interact with our customers
and understand what's on their minds
often at AWS we have we have a chance to
interact with technical stakeholders
people in IT organizations who are
building things using the cloud but it's
great to have an opportunity to talk to
the finance community for example CFOs
and get a feeling for what's on their
minds so that we can improve our
offerings and improve the way that we
communicate
with them
